title: An Eye For Hitchcock - Murray Pomerance.pdf
description:
Film scholar Murray Pomerance presents a series of fascinating meditations on six films directed by the legendary Alfred Hitchcock, a master of the cinema. Two of the films are extraordinarily famous and have been seenÃ¢â‚¬â€œÃ¢â‚¬â€œand misunderstoodÃ¢â‚¬â€œÃ¢â‚¬â€œcountless times: North by Northwest and Vertigo. Two others, Marnie and Torn Curtain, have been mostly disregarded by viewers and critics or considered to be colossal mistakes, while two others, Spellbound and I Confess, have received almost no critical attention at all.
In An Eye for Hitchcock, these movies are seen in a striking new way. Pomerance takes us deep into the structure of HitchcockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s vision and his screen architecture, revealing key elements that have never been written about before. Pomerance also clearly reveals the link between HitchcockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s work and a wide range of thinkers and artists in other fields, thereby offering viewers of HitchcockÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s films the rare opportunity to see them in an entirely new light.
